resources:
"Auto Music "
OMIT NEXT
Welcome! Auto Music helps you to keep your music library more organized.> How does it help you? Fixing the filename, song title, artist, album, etc, even the album picture. Just let it look for and index the songs in your smartphone. Then play a song to fix it in manual mode, semiautomatic or automatic. Or select multiple songs and press the yellow button to fix them automatically, one after the other without you doing anything else, only waiting. UNDERSTOOD
Music library Permission required

General
Rename file The title (if found) will be applied as the filename; the artist name and/or a random number will be added, in case a file with the same name already exists.
Rename file The title that you’ve written will be applied as the filename; the name of the artist and/or a random number will be added, in case a file with the same name already exists.
Rename file The title (if found) will be applied as the filename when you save the changes; the name of the artist and/or a random number will be added, in case a file with the same name already exists.
Remove invalid characters They’re deleted automatically when saving changes. background services A correction of multiple songs will not be canceled when you close the app, but until it finishes or you stop it.
Multimedia Built-in player Listen song in the built-in player.
Overwrite labels If you enable this option all the labels will be replaced by the ones found, if not, only the missing ones will be added.

Descendent Ascendent About Auto Music About the app © GNU GPL 2017 Dark Yellow Studios This app makes use of the following libraries, technologies and resources:
1. How does the app work?
2. Why does it ask to access my pictures and other content in my smartphone?
3. How is it used?
4. What is automatic mode?
5. What is semiautomatic mode?
6. What is manual mode?
7. Which kind of audio files can I fix?
8. How much does the app cost?
9. Why does the information in the list not match with the details of each song?
10. How many songs can I fix?
11. Why can I edit only 8 labels(including cover)?
12. The app doesn’t detect my songs
13. The app doesn’t find the data of my song or what it found is probably incorrect.
14. The app doesn’t find the cover for my song.
15. How long does it take to identify a song?
16. What happens if I close the app while I’m fixing multiple songs?
For each song you have on your smartphone, it generates a digital fingerprint of the audio, after that, it looks in a database for that fingerprint and obtains the corresponding information about the song.
Because some songs are stored in memory, internal or external of your smartphone, the permission is necessary to be able to read them; it’s the only permission required, otherwise, the app would have no useful functionality.
Just touch a song from the list and choose the correction method, or if you want, you can check which ones you want to fix and after that press the yellow button in the lower right corner to fix those songs in automatic mode.
It is the mode where you check the songs you want to fix, press he yellow button, and the app fixes each song for you, including the filename (verify the configuration options if this option is enabled), you don’t have to do anything, just wait until it finishes. Take into account that this method doesn’t require your intervention. NOTE: The file renaming will be applied to every one being fixed at the moment.
This mode will obtain the information about the song, but won’t apply any change until you apply them.
The manual mode allows you to fix by yourself the labels in each song, including the cover, if you have that information at hand. Touch the cover of each song in the list for more options.
Currently Mp3, Mp4 (Mp4 audio, M4a y M4p audio) Ogg Vorbis, Flac, Wma and limited support for Wav and Real audio, which are the ones supported by the JAudioTagger library. But there could be fewer formats because Android doesn’t support some audio formats natively, for example Wma; in future update the complete file types will be supported.
None, but subject to a limit in file corrections.
For performance and loading speed, Auto Music reads the information of each file from MediaStore (Android’s internal DB), because of that, the information shown in each song in the list is what is obtained from this database, and because of the obtaining mechanisms between Android and Auto Music when it shows the detailed information of each song, this could vary a little, but at the end the information that is corrected in any case will be correct.
Because the app uses a free license of the recognition service, the amount of songs that you can fix varies, from a little to probably thousands.
There are more than 35 standard labels, a considerable amount and out of reach of this app, so what is offered is correction for the most important ones.
It can be because permission was not granted to access the storage or, the kind of audio is not supported by Android and/or the library or, the file doesn’t have an extension in the name.
The app consults a database with information of 200 million songs (http://www.gracenote.com/music/music-recognition/), so it’s probable that the song you’re trying to correct, has been downloaded/converted from a low quality audio source and the generated digital finger print is non-existent, try to download /convert with more quality your songs or correct it manually.
Check in the Settings options, in Data consumption and select another cover size, not all the sizes are available for each song.
It depends on the web connection, if it’s good, it will take from 5 to 10 seconds; if the connection is slow it can take more.
The app can work in the background in automatic mode (you have to enable this option in the Settings), that way the correction will continue until it finishes or you stop it. If this option is not active the correction process will be canceled when you close it. For the other modes, the correction will be interrupted if you close the app.
ScrollingAboutActivity Type not supported Corrected labels by semiautomatic mode. There’s no available Internet connection or it was lost. Correction canceled. Yes No All Missing
